properties.name: Amazon River
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomSouth America The Amazon River is located in South America and is the largest river in the world. The Amazon accounts for approximatley one fifth of the worlds river flow. It covers a vast area of South America, about 40%. It takes up 2,670,000 square mile. During the dry seasons the river can be only 7 miles wide ranging up to 28 miles in the rainy seson. More than one third of all the species in the world live in the Amazon Rainforest, which the river supports the diverse range of wildlife. An estimated 3,000 to 5,000 speices of fish live in these waters. The piranhas are found here normally traveling in large numbers. They are notorious for attacking animals and even sometimes humans. Also the anaconda snake is found here where it spends most of its time in the shallow waters.

properties.name: Auschwitz concentration camp
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomKrakow, Poland Auschwitz was the largest Nazi German concentration camp. This camp consisted of three main parts: an administrative center, an extermination camp, and a work camp. Around 2 million people died here. About 90% of them were jews. The outskirts of Auschwitz had 40 satellite camps consisting of dozens of prisoners up to thousands of prisoners. The begining of this camp was in 1940. At the end of the war they sent as many jews as possible to exterminate them. Most of them were killed in gas chambers. Others were killed by starvation, forced labor, lack of disease control, and individual execution.

properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomLondon The Clock Tower is the worlds largest chimming clock. The clock is located in the House of Parliment building in Westminster. The main bell within the clock tower os reffered to as Big Ben. The clock tower was designed by Augustus Pugin, which was one of his last ones. The tower is 315 feet tall. The first 200 feet of teh structure is the clock tower, which is made up of all brick. The ret of the tower is made up of a frame of cast iron. The volume of the tower is 164,200 cubic feet. The clock tower sits 23 feet underground with concrete 10 feet thick.

properties.name: Buckingham Palace
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomLondon, England The Buckingham Palace is the official residence for the british monarch.First the palace started out as a large townhouse built for Duke of Buckingham in 1703. Over the next 75 years the palace was enlarged and redecorated. It was designed by the architects John Nash and Edward Blore. The Buckingham Palace became the official royal palace under Queen Victoria in 1837. The early 19th century designs were brightly colored scagliola and blue and pink. King Edward VII partially decorated it hy cream and gold colour schemes. The Buckingham Palace Garden is the largest private garden in Londen. The artificial lake was completed in 1828. More than 50,000 people visit here each year as guest to banquets, lunches, dinners, receptions, and the royal garden parties.

properties.name: Eiffle Tower
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomParis, France The Eiffle Tower is located in Paris,France. The tower has become a global icon for France and is the most recognizable structure in the world. it stands 1,063 ft. tall. It was constructed from 1887 to 1889. This tower was the worlds tallest tower from 1889-1931. The tower was first used for radio broadcasting. It had a permit for only 20 years and then the city was going to tear it down. But the tower proved to be valuable so they kept it up. This is a great landmark for Paris. Thousands of people around the world travel to see this sight every year.

properties.name: Great Barrier Reef
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomCoral Sea The Great Barrier Reef is the worlds largest coral reef systems. It consist of over 900 individual reefs all stretching over 100,000 square miles. The reefs located off the coast of northeast Australia in the Coral Sea. The coral supports a wide diversity of sea life. Some lable it one of the seven natural wonders of the world. Theres a huge widespread of different species living here. There ranges many types of dolphines all the way to saltwater crocodiles. There are six spesies of sea turtles, 215 species of birds, 125 species of sharks and stingrays, and much more. A small part of the reef is open to the tourist and humans around the area. Most of it is protected by the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park, which helps limit the amount of human use.

properties.name: Great Pyramid Of Giza
properties.description: Posted by Anawisdom The most famous pyramids are the Egyptian ones. These pyramids are one of the largest man-made constructions. Most of these pyramids took around 30 years to build. The Egyptians would put gold at the peaks. Also on the faces they polished it with white limestone. The Great Pyramid of Giza is the largest pyramid in Egypt and one of the largest in the world. The base is over 52,600 square meters in area. It is one of the seven wonders of the world.

properties.name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomChina The Great Wall of China was built to protect the northern borders of teh chinese empire. It was built, rebuilt, and maintained between the 5th century to the 16th century. The Great Wall is as long as 4,160 miles long. At one point in time up to one million men guarded this wall. Its been estimated that 2 to 3 million have dies from building the wall. These walls were built to withstand attacks from small arms such as swords and spears. They were made mostly by board frames held together by gravel and earth. Most of these walls have eroded away over centuries. Under the Ming Dynasty they had trouble with attacks from outsiders so they extended the walls. They built them out of brick now making it stronger lasting longer.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomPhiladelphia, Pennsylvania The Liberty Bell is one of the most significant symbol associated with the American Revolution. It has great historic significance. It is located at the Liberty Bell center. The ball weighs 2,055 pounds abd its circumfrence is 12 ft. The bells most famous ringing was when the Declaration was beind read.

properties.name: White House
properties.description: Posted by AnawisdomWashington DC The White House is the official residenc and work place for the president of the USA. It was built from 1792 to 1800. John Adams was the first president to live here. Since then its an executive residence for every president. President William Howard Taft later expanded the West Wing creating the first Oval Office. In 1817, during the War of 1812, the British troops set the mansion on fire. This completely destroyed the interior walls and most of the exterior. Constrution was started immediatley after. Since then many Presidents have extended on to the house due to crowding and extra space. The White House is 55,000 square feet of floor space. It has 132 rooms, 35 bathrooms, 28 fireplaces, and 3 elevators. It also includes a bowling alley, movie theater, a putting green, and tennis court. An estimated 5,000 people visit each day.
